description: Green Orbit Digital is a Leicester-based agency specialising in sustainable marketing for the space sector, helping organisations achieve impact while reducing environmental footprint.
The Luxembourg Space Agency promotes research, innovation, and investment in the space sector, with a focus on sustainability and economic development.
ESRIC drives European research, innovation, and training in space resources and space mining, supporting sustainable off-Earth resource utilisation.
Hub Exhibitions specialises in creating immersive exhibitions and events that connect audiences with space, science, and technology topics.
A network of universities collaborating on space education, research, and innovation initiatives to advance knowledge and sustainable space development.
Culture Declares is a global network of cultural organisations committed to taking action against climate change and promoting sustainable practices in the arts.
The ITU is the United Nations specialised agency for information and communication technologies, coordinating global telecom standards and satellite spectrum management.

organisation: United Nations Platform for Space-based Information for Disaster Management and Emergency Response
description: UN-SPIDER provides access to space-based information to support disaster management and emergency response worldwide, promoting the use of satellite data for resilience.
The Carbon Literacy Project delivers training and awareness programmes to empower individuals and organisations to reduce carbon emissions and act on climate change.
Small Business Britain champions the interests of small businesses, providing support, networking, and recognition to help them grow and thrive in competitive markets.
EUMETSAT operates meteorological satellites to monitor climate, weather, and environmental conditions across Europe, supporting scientific research and operational services.
The UK Space Agency leads the nation's civil space programme, supporting innovation, research, and partnerships that drive economic growth, scientific discovery, and sustainable use of space.

organisation: United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs
description: UNOOSA promotes international cooperation in the peaceful use and exploration of space, ensuring space activities contribute to sustainable development and benefit all humankind.

organisation: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
description: The UNFCCC drives global action to combat climate change, supporting countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and adapt to climate impacts.
ORB leads the responsible business movement for solo, micro & small businesses.
Rainforest Foundation UK works alongside Indigenous peoples and local communities to protect rainforests, safeguard biodiversity, and address the climate crisis through rights-based approaches.
The University of Leicester is a leading UK research institution, recognised globally for its expertise in space science, planetary exploration, and Earth observation technologies.
INCO Academy provides innovative training programmes to equip individuals with the digital and green skills needed for the jobs of tomorrow, fostering inclusive and sustainable growth.
Leicester City Council is the local authority for the city of Leicester, working to deliver sustainable urban development, community services, and economic opportunities.
Space Park Leicester is a collaborative hub for space research, innovation, and industry, enabling partnerships that drive advancements in satellite technology, data analytics, and sustainability.

organisation: UK Earth Observation Network for Sustainability
description: The UK Earth Observation Network for Sustainability connects researchers, industry, and policymakers to leverage satellite data for tackling environmental challenges and advancing sustainable development goals.
Space4Climate is a professional network bringing together expertise in climate services from space, helping to turn satellite data into actionable insights for climate resilience and sustainability.
SmartCitiesWorld is an online platform providing news, insights, and best practices on smart city innovations, helping urban leaders develop more sustainable, connected, and resilient communities.
The National Centre for Earth Observation delivers world-class research using satellite data to monitor and understand environmental change, supporting policy, industry, and public services.
The Space Communications Alliance is a global network of marketing and PR professionals dedicated to raising awareness of the space industry and its contribution to innovation and sustainability.
Space Partnership is a UK initiative that brings together industry, academia, and government to coordinate space sector growth and deliver strategic benefits to the economy and society.
The Climate Coalition is the UK’s largest group of organisations dedicated to action on climate change, uniting voices to protect the things we love and promote a sustainable future.
Climate Perks partners with employers to offer paid travel days for low-carbon journeys, encouraging sustainable transport choices and reducing business travel emissions.
The Supply Chain Sustainability School is a free, award-winning virtual learning platform providing sustainability training to professionals in the built environment sector.
The International Space University offers interdisciplinary space education, fostering global cooperation and developing leaders to meet the challenges of humanity’s future in space.
The Space Safety Coalition is an industry-led initiative promoting best practices and guidelines for the safe and sustainable use of outer space.
The BSI Sustainable Space Community is a forum for organisations committed to developing standards and practices that ensure space activities are environmentally and socially responsible.
Leicester Startups is a community network supporting entrepreneurs and early-stage businesses through events, mentoring, and collaboration opportunities.
Space City Leicester is a dedicated cluster for space-related businesses, research, and innovation, supporting economic growth and collaboration in the space sector.
Cosmos for Humanity promotes sustainable and inclusive space exploration, ensuring the benefits of space are shared by all people and future generations.
The SME Climate Hub provides tools, resources, and commitments for small and medium-sized businesses to reduce emissions and align with net-zero targets.
The TNFD develops a risk management and disclosure framework for organisations to report and act on nature-related risks, supporting a shift in global financial flows toward nature-positive outcomes.
DOCK is a Leicester-based innovation hub providing office space, labs, and support for high-tech and low-carbon businesses.
Place Support Partnership helps local authorities and communities improve town centre vitality through business engagement, support, and resilience-building initiatives.
The Space Enterprise Community is a digital platform connecting UK space professionals, fostering collaboration, innovation, and knowledge-sharing across the sector.
The European Space Agency is an intergovernmental organisation dedicated to the exploration and use of space for peaceful purposes, advancing science, technology, and sustainability.
Sustainable East Midlands is a regional network promoting low-carbon initiatives, green business practices, and environmental collaboration.
SpaceProjects.uk showcases and supports UK-led space projects, encouraging collaboration between researchers, industry, and educators.
GreenerFuture Leicestershire is a local initiative focused on community-led sustainability projects, environmental education, and climate action.
Climate Impact Partners delivers high-quality carbon credit solutions and climate finance to help organisations achieve net-zero goals while supporting sustainable development projects.
The Sustainable Business Alliance brings together companies committed to environmental responsibility, social equity, and ethical governance.

organisation: UK Students for the Exploration and Development of Space
description: UKSEDS is the UK’s national student space society, supporting and inspiring students to pursue careers in the space industry through projects, competitions, and outreach.

organisation: International Society for Development and Sustainability
description: The International Society for Development and Sustainability promotes sustainable development research and practice through global collaboration and knowledge exchange.
Justspace Alliance advocates for a more inclusive and ethical space future, addressing issues of environmental sustainability, social justice, and responsible governance.
The Zero Waste International Alliance promotes zero waste principles globally, supporting communities, businesses, and governments in reducing waste and protecting resources.
The Institute of Physics is a scientific charity working to advance physics education, research, and application for the benefit of society.
The IAU Centre for the Protection of the Dark and Quiet Sky from Satellite Constellation Interference coordinates global efforts to safeguard astronomy from the impact of satellite constellations.
SpacePride is an inclusive community celebrating diversity in the space sector and promoting equal opportunities for all space professionals.
The Circular Economy Club is a global non-profit network connecting professionals and organisations to accelerate the transition to a circular economy.
ClimateAction.tech is a community of tech professionals taking climate action by sharing knowledge, tools, and best practices for building a sustainable digital future.
The Zero Emissions Network helps businesses and residents reduce emissions by promoting active travel, electric vehicles, and cleaner air initiatives.
The Chartered Institute of Public Relations is a professional body representing PR practitioners, promoting best practice, skills development, and ethical standards.
The Chartered Institute of Marketing is the world’s leading professional marketing body, providing training, resources, and accreditation to marketers worldwide.
The Midlands Space Cluster is a regional initiative uniting businesses, research institutions, and local authorities to grow the space economy in the Midlands.

organisation: European Association of Remote Sensing Companies
description: The European Association of Remote Sensing Companies represents the Earth observation industry, fostering growth, partnerships, and the uptake of satellite-based services.
UKspace is the official trade association for the UK space industry, representing and promoting the sector’s interests to government, media, and international stakeholders.
The Federation of Small Businesses champions the interests of small business owners and the self-employed through advocacy, resources, and networking opportunities.
CharityComms is the professional membership network for charity communicators, providing training, best practice, and peer support to enhance impact across the sector.
Designers in Space is a global community for creatives working in or inspired by the space sector, fostering collaboration and design-led innovation in space exploration.
Ecosend is an email marketing platform designed to minimise environmental impact, using carbon offsetting and energy-efficient infrastructure for sustainable digital communications.
The Association of British Science Writers supports, promotes, and defends the professional interests of science writers, journalists, and communicators in the UK.
Climate Voice mobilises employees, students, and the public to push organisations towards bold climate action and advocacy for systemic environmental change.
ACT Climate Labs is a collaborative initiative developing creative campaigns and strategies to inspire large-scale climate action and public engagement.
Creatives for Climate is a global network of creative professionals using storytelling, design, and campaigns to accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.
Enterprise Nation is a small business network offering advice, resources, training, and community support to help entrepreneurs start and grow their ventures.
Future Earth is a global research network advancing sustainability science to support transformations towards a resilient, equitable, and sustainable planet.
Green Economy connects businesses with low-carbon solutions, helping organisations reduce their environmental impact and transition to net zero.
The Global Space Enablers Network fosters equitable entrepreneurial ecosystems in developing and emerging countries to ensure inclusive access to the opportunities of space.
Leaders for Climate Action is a global community of entrepreneurs and changemakers committed to measurable emissions reduction and climate advocacy.
Net Zero Carbon Events is an industry-wide initiative supporting the events sector in reducing greenhouse gas emissions and achieving net zero by 2050.
Krystal provides sustainable web hosting powered by renewable energy, combining high-performance services with a commitment to environmental responsibility.
Plusnet is a UK-based broadband and telecommunications provider known for affordable services and customer-focused support.
Stripe is a global payments platform that enables businesses to securely accept and manage online transactions while offering tools to support growth.
Tide is a UK-based digital banking platform offering accounts, payment services, and tools tailored for small businesses and entrepreneurs.
Rebel Business School delivers practical, free training that empowers people to start and grow businesses without debt or traditional constraints.
Ecodemy provides sustainability-focused education and training, helping individuals and organisations gain the skills to create positive environmental change.
Locality is a national membership network supporting community organisations to create thriving, inclusive, and sustainable local places.
IAF is a global network of space agencies, companies, and institutions promoting international cooperation in astronautics and space exploration.

organisation: European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts
description: ECMWF provides global medium-range weather forecasts, supporting climate research, operational meteorology, and environmental monitoring across Europe.
DarkSky International works to protect the night environment and preserve dark skies through responsible outdoor lighting, education, and advocacy worldwide.
The Copernicus programme monitors the Earth using satellite data to support environmental management, climate monitoring, and disaster response in Europe.
Wholegrain Digital is a web agency specialising in sustainable digital design, focusing on energy efficiency, accessibility, and ethical online experiences.
The Plant-Based Treaty campaign promotes global policies to reduce reliance on animal agriculture and accelerate a transition to sustainable plant-based food systems.
Mercator Ocean monitors and models the global ocean to support climate research, operational oceanography, and marine environmental policy decisions.
The Portuguese Space Agency coordinates Portugal's civil space activities, supporting research, industry growth, and international cooperation in space science.
SWF is an NGO promoting the sustainable and secure use of outer space through policy research, advocacy, and international collaboration.
B Lab UK certifies and supports businesses that meet high standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability.
DWP is a UK government department responsible for welfare, pensions, and employment services, helping citizens access financial support and social security.
GoSquared provides website analytics, live chat, and marketing automation tools to help businesses grow and optimise digital customer engagement.
Exotopic develops innovative digital and physical experiences for education, culture, and science communication with a focus on immersive storytelling.
The Good Business Foundation supports socially and environmentally responsible businesses with guidance, resources, and networking opportunities.
SRI advocates for a new era of human space settlement and sustainable space development, focusing on advocacy, education, and international collaboration.
The United Nations promotes international cooperation across peace, development, human rights, and sustainability, including its space-related programmes and initiatives.
